intro: Trianosperma lhotzkyanum, commonly known as the Lhotzkyanum spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features small, clustered flowers surrounded by colorful bracts, giving it a striking appearance. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a waxy texture. Trianosperma lhotzkyanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
